Summary_and_Clinical_Considerations.summary: 78-year-old male patient with Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation, systolic blood pressure 141 mmHg, diastolic blood pressure 64 mmHg, pulse 71 minutes, haemoglobin 14 g/dL, and total cholesterol 3.7 mmol/L
clinicalConsiderations: The patient's diagnosis of Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation requires further evaluation and management to prevent stroke and thromboembolism
